tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE public_sector_employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    full_name VARCHAR(255),
    department VARCHAR(100),
    position VARCHAR(100),
    salary DECIMAL(10, 2),
    hire_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE public_sector_employees (
    employee_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    first_name TEXT NOT NULL,
    last_name TEXT NOT NULL,
    position TEXT,
    department TEXT,
    salary DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE employee_contacts (
    contact_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id UUID,
    email TEXT,
    phone_number TEXT,
    address TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES public_sector_employees(employee_id)
);

CREATE TABLE public_sector_employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_name VARCHAR(50),
    department VARCHAR(50),
    salary DECIMAL(10, 2),
    hire_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE employee_contacts (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    phone_number VARCHAR(15),
    email VARCHAR(50),
    address VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE employee_leaves (
    leave_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    leave_start_date DATE,
    leave_end_date DATE,
    leave_type VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE public_sector_employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50),
    department VARCHAR(50),
    salary DECIMAL(10, 2),
    joining_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE employee_addresses (
    address_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT REFERENCES public_sector_employees(employee_id),
    address_line VARCHAR(100),
    city VARCHAR(50),
    state VARCHAR(50),
    postal_code VARCHAR(10)
)

CREATE TABLE employee_contacts (
    contact_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT REFERENCES public_sector_employees(employee_id),
    phone_number VARCHAR(15),
    email VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE employee_leave_balances (
    leave_balance_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT REFERENCES public_sector_employees(employee_id),
    annual_leave_days INT,
    sick_leave_days INT,
    maternity_leave_days INT
)
CREATE TABLE public_sector_employees ( id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(50), department VARCHAR(50), position VARCHAR(50), salary DECIMAL(10, 2) );
CREATE TABLE employee_contacts ( id INT PRIMARY KEY, employee_id INT, email VARCHAR(50), phone_number VARCHAR(15), address VARCHAR(100) );
CREATE TABLE employee_leave_records ( id INT PRIMARY KEY, employee_id INT, start_date DATE, end_date DATE, leave_type VARCHAR(20), status VARCHAR(20) );
CREATE TABLE employee_training_records ( id INT PRIMARY KEY, employee_id INT, course_name VARCHAR(50), start_date DATE, end_date DATE, instructor VARCHAR(50) );
CREATE TABLE employee_performance_reviews ( id INT PRIMARY KEY, employee_id INT, review_date DATE, reviewer VARCHAR(50), rating INT, comments TEXT );
